text: LOCAL RADIO quietly rattles through blown speakers. Four YOUNG MEN lie contorted within, sound asleep. A muted sunbeam cuts through their hanging breath and fin PAT (20s, a doe-eyed vandal) in the rear cargo hold. He blinks awake and sits up, grasping for equilibrium. He turns and wipes the fogged porthole window behind him.
BATTERED GREEN STALKS tight against the glass.
Shit.
The weathered conversion van sits in a cornfield, a wake trampled stalks marking its thirty yard drift from the ro The landscape is vast, coastal.
Pat crawls between the bucket seats and puts a hand on SA (late 20s, scruffy), asleep in the front passenger seat.
Sam. Wake-up. REECE (20s, a natural athlete), sits up from between EQUIPMENT CASES, encased in a SLEEPING BAG.
What’s wrong?  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 2 Sam wipes the windshield clear, sees the WALL OF CORN.
(slapping the driver) What’d you do, Tiger? The driver, TIGER (20s, a wiry mutt with dyed blue hair) jolts alert and surveys the scene.
Did we crash?
You tell us, asshole.
Guess I fell asleep.
With the engine running. THE FUEL GAUGE NEEDLE SITS BELOW ‘E’.
Well done. Sam disconnects his CELL PHONE from a cigarette lighter adapter. It CHIRPS.
Full charge. Did you kill the battery too?

You hear the radio? Pat reaches over, yanks the keys and kills the LOCAL RADI EXT. CONVERSION VAN —- CORNFIELD - DAY 4 TRACKING SAM, swiping his phone, rounding the open rear d of the van as Reece and Tiger unload stickered-up CASES. We see them now. ROCK SHIRTS, TATTOOS, SHITTY HAIRCUTS- THEY’RE A PUNK BAND.
There’s a skating rink eleven miles from here. Big parking lot. Pat hops from the van, dragging out a battered BMX BIKE.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)
Ice skating or roller skating?
Just says they’re open. Why? Pat pulls a DUFFEL BAG and GAS CAN from the van.
Hockey players whoop more ass.
Dunno, dude- I’ve seen some pretty badass roller skaters...
At 7am? I’1l come with. Pat nods, shrugs the Duffel over his shoulder.
Pat pedals the BMX down the highway, Sam sits atop mounted luggage rack transfixed by his phone, feet the BACK WHEEL PEGS.
That thing ruins everything.
..-huh?

If we didn’t know where we were going, we'd be on a quest. But we do... so it’s an errand. It’s a serene morning, Sam YAWNS. EXT. SKATING RINK —- PARKING LOT - DAY a rear resting on PUSHING IN on a gravel lot. The unmanned BMX wheels down DRAINAGE DITCH and falls over. Pat and Sam follow its path, taking cover in the ditch. S scans the lot as Pat removes a SIPHON KIT from the duffel: 1/4" CLEAR TUBING, a length of BLACK RUBBER HOSE, and a stained RAG.
Thar she blows...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 4 Near the edge of the lot sits a monster SUV.

Pat and Sam scamper to a crouch beside the SUV. Sam unscrews the gas cap. Pat feeds one end of the clear tubing into the tank, the other into their canister. He shoves the rubber hose into the tank and presses the rag as a seal. Pat blows two hard breaths into the hose. Gas TRICKLES then POURS into the canister. Shared grins. A metal CLANK. ECHOES from a cavernous interior. Pat springs up and peers through the TINTED SUV WINDOWS, seeing PARENTS corralling PEE-WEE HOCKEY PLAYERS from a r access door into the lot. Pat crouches, signals to pack it up. Sam pulls the rig.
Pat pedals up the highway, Sam on the rack, hunched over phone. An SUV rounds the corner, its RPMs break the quiet.
(looking up) Uh oh. Pat turns to see the SUV gaining, CURSES.
What are we doing?

Cover the gas. Get ready to run. Sam hastily covers the gas canister with his jacket as th SUV slows beside them. They look ahead, playing it not-so cool. The SUV window rolls down, revealing a HOCKEY MOM.
Not safe, what you boys did...
(half-assed) We didn’t do anything, ma’am.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)
I can smell it. (pointing) That’s it, there. Pat drags his feet to a stop. Hockey Mom follows suit. No visible are two PEE-WEE HOCKEY PLAYERS pressed to the bac seat glass.
We’re sorry.
It’s dangerous. If you boys needed gas, I would've given it to you.
Oh. Thank you. Her scolding eyes.
...sincerely.
Next time, you ask.
Yes ma’am. Pat nods earnestly.
You broken down? I can give you a ride.
We'll be fine.

Alright. Be safe, now... and you go with Christ. The SUV cruises off. Sam glances to Pat, who makes the sign of the cross and resumes pedaling. Sam signs the cross with his right hand BUT GRABS IT WITH HIS LEFT, pantomiming an epic hand figh
Oh no. Oh dear! (death-metal ghoulish)
10 11 12 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 6 Sam's left hand wins out and thrusts into the air: his pi and index fingers protruding from a balled fist: THE MANO

head_text.subj: SWEEPING ABOVE CORN STALKS AS SAM, TIGER AND PAT PUSH THE
FROM SUNKEN SOIL AND CHASE IT ONTO THE HIGHWAY SHOULDER.

text: WIND WHIPS through the van. MUSIC BLARES, wild hair.
The van cruises along coastal highway.

head_text.subj: ON A CELL PHONE TOUCH SCREEN

text: ‘Corner of 12th & Ocean_'. A THUMB TAPS THE REST OF THE TEXT MESSAGE: ‘I have a moho ‘SEND’. THE THUMB HASTILY RE-TYPES: ‘Mohawk_’ ‘SEND’. TILT UP to reveal the conversion van GROWL up to the corn TAD (19), in homemade rags sporting a liberty-spiked Moha meets the passenger window as Sam TURNS THE MUSIC DOWN.
Sam?
Tad.
Awesome. Hey, I work nights- but I'll catch up with you guys for breakfast. Tad hands over HOUSE KEYS on a chain, ties on an APRON.  13 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 7
Okay...
I’m in 2R, up the stairs, just crash wherever. Park in the side lot- rear doors tight to the wall so no one steals your shit.
(looks to Reece, at wheel) Yeah? Reece raises his eyebrows and the van lurches forward.
A cramped refuge scattered with ART SUPPLIES, ZINES, and PARAPHERNALIA. Reece steals a workout, chair-dipping in the living area. Sam sorts through PACKETS of Ramen Noodles on the kitchen counter.
These all have mushrooms. Tiger inspects a bookshelf collection of VINYL LPs.
This dude's legit. Pat examines a cluster of framed CAT PHOTOS on a dresser.
Why? (finishing his dips) He gets up early to do his hair? Tiger defensively brushes his hair back and un-sleeves an
He’s true. Sam pulls a SIXER from the fridge, tosses one to Reece, w unplugging the charging phone.
Who you calling?
That your business?  14 15 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)
I get the bills. Reece backs down, cracks his beer.
I’m going to bed.
(cracking a beer) We're going to drink. Tiger seats the LP on a turntable, sets the needle down, just as the LP CRACKLES TO LIFE with a signature COUNT OF

INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - THE NEXT MORNING 14 CLOSE-UP: THE NEEDLE BOBS AT THE EDGE OF THE SPINNING LP. SOFT IN THE BACKGROUND, Pat stands up out of frame, zombi walks to the turntable and powers it down. WE TRACK BEHIND PAT as he grabs half-empty BEER CANS and pours them into the kitchenette sink.
Tad climbs the steps two at a time carrying grocery bags. WE FLOAT BEHIND PAT as he opens the door for Tad.

Morning! (biting lip) You the first to fall asleep? INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - MORNING 15 Pat is hunched over the sink. He rises, inspecting his fa in the mirror, scrubbing it with a moldy bar of soap. ON PAT’S FACE, crudely penned in SHARPIE: A BIG, STUPID MONOCLE AROUND HIS EYE AND CAT WHISKERS ON HIS CHEEKS.  16 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 9 INT. TAD’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - MORNING 16 A compact DIGITAL RECORDER blinks RED on a coffee table. The Band sits huddled on a couch, plates of scrambled egg their laps. Tad sits opposite, cross-legged on the floor.
..-working on anything new?
A few songs. Maybe enough for a seven-inch.
Sweet! Will you actually press one?
If we can afford it.
I dig the analogue style. Which brings me to the fact: you guys are hard to find. Why no social media presence? Pat contains a wince. Sam turns to face Tiger.
Because booking more shows and selling more records would blow.
It’s not hard-rock.
Says the one who gets smashed and plays Darby Crash at the shows I book on my phone... Tiger looks to his plate, eats some eggs.
No one wants to starve, but if you take it all virtual, you lose... the texture.
What do you mean, texture?
Just- you gotta be there. The music is for effect. It’s time and aggression and...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 10
Technical wizardry.
-..t’s shared- live. And then it goes away. The energy- it can’t last.
Unless you’re Iggy Pop.
And good for him. I just don’t think I’1l be in my 70’s still listening to Minor Threat.
Tiger will. Right?
I won’t live to be seventy. Reece and Sam blurt out mocking laughs, Pat drifts.
Okay, so this is a good segue into one of my traditions. For each of you, name your ‘desert island’ band. Reece rolls his eyes.
Only one?
If I were to say Black Sabbath, would I get Ozzy and Dio?
No caveats- just name the band. Sam, Reece, Pat and Tiger size each other up...
Misfits. No, The Damned. Misfits.
Poison Idea.
(under breath) Shit man...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 11
Cro-Mags. Pat, shaking his head, stressing out.
Just say something, dude.
Steely Dan.
Candlebox.
He’s a Juggalo.
Ah, man. (rubs face) Will this be edited?
I'll chop it up a bit.
Let it go raw.
When will this air? Shouldn’t we plug the show?
(thrown) Yeah... He turns off the recorder.
My last show at the muni center didn’t end well. Lots of vomit. Some fecal matter. Tiger smiles.
County commissioner got wind and pulled my permit. You were already en route.
Damn dude. We need a kill fee.  17 18 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 12
We went 90 miles out of our way.
I’ve got a backup lined-up. Lunch, 50% cut on the door, and you guys would headline.
Anyone else still on the bill?
They bailed. Deadpan from the Band as GUITAR FEEDBACK BUILDS...

A waterside mexican cafe. No frills except strung-up CHRISTMAS LIGHTS. THE BAND BLASTS OUT A CHARGED, RAPID-FIRE PUNK SONG. Sam teases FEEDBACK from an AMP with his LES PAUL. Pat on BASS, eyes trained on the floor. Behind a DRUM KIT, Reece strikes with precision. TIGER SCREAMS into a MIC. ON THE ETHNICALLY DIVERSE CROWD: Less than a dozen. Most them sitting down. Some eating Mexican from PAPER PLATES. TAKE-OUT CUSTOMERS plugging their ears as they’re rung-up A DIEHARD, slamdancing with himself. Two BACK-PACK KIDS nodding heads. A FAN, archiving the performance with an iPHONE. The Band screeches to a halt with heaving chests.
(exasperated, to the Fan) Turn that shit off...

Tiger rolls CASES to Pat. Pat lifts them into the van. Re shoves them into place. Tad holds two bags of MEXICAN TAKE-OUT, watching Sam coun meager stack of CRUMPLED BILLS.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 13
I gave you my cut. The house got theirs, but I di-
(finishing the count) Split four ways it’s six dollars each.
Six eighty-seven. Eighty-eight if you round up. Which I don’t-
(charging) You dipshit fashion-punk clown motherFUCKER... Reece SLAMS Tad against a wall, the take-out drops.
Christ.
Easy there, Jujitsu. Reece presses his forearm heavy against Tad’s neck, resis the urge to inflict real damage.
(to Reece) Let’s not go to jail too. (to Tad) I think you just ended this tour.
Fuck yes. Let’s call it.
Make a beeline to D.C.? We've got enough for one tank- it’d be siphoning the rest of the way.
(releasing Tad) Not a problem. (snatching the take-out) We've got rice and beans!
We can head up north and catch 80 all the way. Reece, Tiger and Sam head for the van.  19 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 14
Lemme call my cousin. I can get you a solid gig. Reece mounts the van, SLAMS the door. The rest stick arou
Where? Here?
Scene’s dead. You'd have to dip down closer to Portland. INT./EXT. CONVERSION VAN - TAD’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 19 Tiger sits shotgun, Sam behind the wheel.
I say we just gank his vinyl. Pat and Reece sit eyeballing each other in the back of th IDLING VAN. Sam's phone CHIMES as Tad jogs up to the window.
It's set. Matinee tomorrow, Doors at one, you’re on at three. I texted the addy.
How much?
$350, minus your tab. The band plays it down, but this is a windfall.
And just so you know, it’s mostly boots and braces down there.
Skins? There’s some at every show.
SHARP? DMS? Sabre?
Right wing- or, technically ultra left- but not affiliated. (MORE)
Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 15
Dude who owns the venue doesn’t rely on door money- sells more than just booze...
But your cousin is cool?
Yeah- don’t talk politics, but stick with Daniel. I’d tag along but he and his girl are coming here to crash. Gotta vacuum and shit.
But no one’s burning crosses or anything- we just play rock?
I'd play your earlier stuff. Heavier stuff.
(refined accent) These gentlemen like to mosh.
Girls too. It’s sorta the only scene in town. Here... Tad hands Tiger a black and white FLYER.
I usually keep the originals, but since this one never happened... Tiger tucks the flyer away.
Can I still run that interview...?
Yeah- what station is it on?
FM eighty-five-five- “Breakfast of Champions”. Thanks. Tiger dials in the station, Sam puts the van in gear and smacks Reece’s arm as they pull out.
.--sorry I almost obliterated you!  20 21 22 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 16
Not a problemmmmnn...
PITCH BLACK. The WHIR of the road.

head_text.subj: A FLASHLIGHT BEAM POPS ON, SCANS ACROSS HAND DRAWN IMAGES

text: Horned skulls, fleshy tendrils and a liquid font of zombi vomit: ‘$5 Matinee! Missionary Position, Ain't Rights, NT Sat lpm Seaside Municipal Center’
At least dude can draw. Tiger hands TAD’S FLYER and the flashlight back to Pat. They're all eating rice and beans with plastic forks. Pat inspects the flyer and offers it to Reece.
Pretty sweet. Reece looks up from the flyer, the glow from the flashlig up-lighting his face, and gives Pat a soul-penetrating st
There's something I never told you. Anyone, for that matter...
What’s that? Holding the stare, Reece RIPS A FART. The Van ERUPTS INTO LAUGHTER as Reece tosses the flyer and Pat pounces.
The van passes an APPLE ORCHARD and turns down a two-lane road bordered by dense inland foliage.
Mapping Software tracks their position. Nothing else arou  23 24 25 26 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 17
FROM ABOVE, TRACKING THE VAN as it’s swallowed by woods.
FROM BEHIND a closed ENTRY GATE, with a SIGN facing the r The van whips by...

THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: the narrow road opens into a cul- sac of dirt and trampled grass. On the far end lies THE VENUE, a converted public utility building of brick and sandstone with a cheap-siding addit extending from the rear. The lot is cluttered with 4x4s, WEATHERED SEDANS and TRIC OUT HATCHBACKS. ROCKERS and SKINHEADS trickle into the ve

The van rolls up and the Band dismounts, gulping fresh ai they're greeted by DANIEL (27), bomber jacket, boots and grown-in buzz cut, breaking from a group of TAILGATERS admiring a pale gold ‘65 PONTIAC RAGTOP at the lot’s edge
You guys Tad’s friends?
We- he sent us. Cousin Dan?
(shaking hands) Daniel. You guys look hammered. GABE (30s), crew cut and a general disdain, approaches cradling a clip board.
One night at Tad’s will do it. And if your girl is crashing t- Daniel grabs Sam and presses their foreheads together.
(quiet, through a smile) Do not mention that.  27 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 18
I was-
No worries whatsoever. Just shut the fuck up about him and me and her. Daniel releases shaken Sam with a friendly pat.
(arriving) Who’s the Drummer?
Me.
Just bring your cymbals- you're using the house kit.
Okay. Tiger motions to a church-style SIGN out front: In encased changeable letters: ‘1PM DOORS: COWCATCHER, KOKYTUS, AREN'T RIGHTS’ Before Tiger speaks up, Pat calls him off with a look.

HARD ROCK over the PA. MOVING DOWN A DARK NARROW HALLWAY: lugging gear, the Band follows Gabe through a backstage corridor. Gabe rounds a corner and gestures to BIG JUSTIN (26), a tattooed heavyweight who dutifully steps aside for the procession. Gabe stops at a graffiti-covered door.
(over music)

head_text.subj: STAGE IN HERE. KEEP THE HALLWAY

text: CLEAR- OWNER DOESN’T FUCK AROUND

head_text.subj: WITH FIRE CODE. SOUND CHECK IN

text: GoT IT.  28 29 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 19

MUFFLED ROCK. A fluorescent-lit interior with carpet remnants, a ratty couch, a bare-bulb Formica makeup count and a coffin-sized bathroom with curtains for a door. Two decades of history told in BAND STICKERS and SHARPIE SCRA Sam yanks ELECTRIC HAIR CLIPPERS from the counter-top out and plugs in his cell phone charger. CHIRP.
You okay?
Yeah. Are these guys not creeps? Tiger and Pat strap on GUITARS, scanning the GRAFFITI SCR Tiger finds a SWASTIKA, looks to Pat.
(stacking cases) Run a tight ship.
But it’s a U-boat...
Hey ya’ll. I got a dumb idea.
Sun pours through the high casement windows, side-lightin the gathering crowd. Lots of shaved heads and bomber jack
Where’d you say the power suppl- SAM'S CRUNCHING GUITAR INTERRUPTS. Sound check fiddle-fad as the PA MUSIC fades out.
It’s like a mini-transformer, with three females- like an XLR, but not- Pat plays a familiar BASS RIFF.
GoT IT. More GUITAR CRUNCH. Then a LOW, RHYTHMIC TOM DRUM MARCH.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 20
(into mic) TEST. ONE-TWO. MEOW. More guitar on mine, please. His monitor turns up, then a look to Reece. Reece nods back. The DRUM MARCH BUILDS.
(into mic) Thank you. TUNING guitars, Sam and Pat lean in for an off-mic aside.

head_text.subj: YOUR IDEA. YOU BACK OUT NOW, I TELL

text: THEM YOU’RE JEWISH. (to Tiger) Go!
(into mic) Okay, everybody! We’re the Ain’t Rights. Or the Aren't Rights. Either one-TWO-THREE-FOUR! !! THE BAND GRINDS STRAIGHT INTO a classic DEAD KENNEDYS SON

(singing into mic) Punk ain't no religious cult Punk means thinkin’ for yourself You ain't hardcore ‘cuz you spike your hair, When a jock still lives inside your head... The crowd barely sways, those who know the song give cold stares... TIGER (CONT’D) Nazi punks, Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Nazi punks, Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Now some BOOS and middle fingers.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 21 TIGER (CONT’D) If you've come to fight, get outta here, You ain't no better than the bouncers, We ain't trying to be police When you ape the cops it ain't anarchy.. Carving through the crowd, a towering skinhead, WERM (28) appears leading a pack of four: two GUYS, wearing jackets with white stenciled ‘COWCATCHER’ logos, and two GIRLS. TIGER (CONT’D) Nazi punks,Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Nazi punks, Nazi punks Nazi punks- Fuck Off! Making his way across the half-stunned pit, Werm glances at the stage, amused. Behind him, EMILY (20s), with a Chelsea hairdo, crosses p with Daniel, who discreetly passes her a FOLDED NAPKIN an disappears into the crowd. Her eyes meet Pat’s and he is struck. She flips him off. AMBER (20s), lights a cigarette, steering her back on cou TIGER (CONT’D) Ten guys jump one, what a man You fight each other, the police state wins Stab your backs when you trash our halls Trash a bank if you've got real balls A bottle SMASHES on stage, Sam and Pat share nervous smil Tiger flubs some lyrics, Reece drums too fast to notice. TIGER (CONT’D) You still think swastikas look cool The real Nazis run your schools They're coaches, businessmen and cops In a real fourth reich you'll be the first to go... Pat searches for the Emily, but Werm’s pack is gone. He finds Daniel, arms crossed at the exit, watching him. Pat joins Sam off-mic for the chorus:
(MORE)
30 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 22
The rowdy crowd SHOUTS BACK. Another BOTTLE flies on stag
You'll be the first to go You'll be the first to go You'll be the first to go Unless you think! AND THEY GRIND TO A HALT, sweat drenched, tension in the

(into mic) Thank you. That was a cover. (off mic to the Band) Whaddya wanna do next? Reece pounds a BROODING DRUM BEAT. The Band trades looks, shrugging acceptance. Sam and Pat TUNE DOWN their guitars and the tone goes evil...
Here’s a treat...

head_text.subj: THEY PLUNGE INTO CORONARY- A FOOT-STOMPING, HARDCORE ASSA

text: The BREAKDOWN hits and the CROWD ERUPTS:

head_text.subj: LIVE SOUND IS CONSUMED BY A SUBLIME, QUIET DRONE
THRASHING BODIES. HARD-LIT SWEAT. SILENT SCREAMS.
TIGER. SAM. PAT. REECE. PERFECT SYNC.
PUSHING DOWN THE HALLWAY, THE DRONE FADES...

text: ... INTO EIGHTIES THRASH METAL blasting over the PA. END SLO-MO. Gabe hands Big Justin a WAD OF BILLS by the green room entrance and jogs down an adjacent hallway carrying a GRO BAG, its plastic contents rattling within.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 23 The Band rounds the corner, sidestepping THEIR OWN STENCI GEAR, now neatly stacked along the hallway.
(over music) WHAT HAPPENED TO ‘FIRE CODE’?
(counting bills)

head_text.subj: SORRY, HAD TO MAKE ROOM FOR THE

text: (handing over bills) YUP. GOTTA CLEAR OUT. Sam takes the cash and looks to Reece, who thumbs-up an equipment inventory.
Big Justin grabs a case and leads them away. Tiger, Reece, Sam and Pat grab cases, rolling out in unis Sam stops and pats his pockets.
Shit. My phone...
MY PHONE. I’LL CATCH UP. Sam tries to squeeze by but Pat holds up a hand.
Pat whips around and heads back.
31 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 24 Big Justin turns to roll his case over a floor seam and s Pat moving toward the green room.
Hearing only THRASH METAL, Pat casually turns the knob, KNOCKING as he pushes the door open into the room. Big Justin barrels towards him, encumbered by gear... BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D) MOTHER FUCK.
Pat goes straight for Sam’s phone.

(yanking the charger) Pardon me, ya’ll- Four PEOPLE and not a word. All eyes on Pat. And there she is... Bent awkwardly on the couch is Emily, a BUCK KNIFE DRIVEN DEEP INTO HER SKULL. Very little blood.
Holy shit. Werm looks up, flushed but relaxed. Amber stands horror-struck in the corner.
Call the police. Werm shrugs indifferent.
Fuck that. Big Justin BURSTS into the room.

(big breaths) .-.to follow. Pat dry swallows. Then BOLTS TO THE DOOR WITH THE PHONE.  32 33 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 25 Big Justin grabs a fistful of hoodie, RIPPING it off as P scrambles past...
Pat leaps across the threshold with a stretched t-shirt, DIALING and flailing, the charger dangling from the phone
The Band catches on as Big Justin emerges, eyes bulging. Avoiding their strewn gear, Pat re-directs down the adjac hall, the Band right behind.
(into cell) YES, IT IS... Gabe appears at the far end of the hallway with the DRUMM
(into cell) I DON’T- A ROCK CLUB... They sprint to intercept.
Gabe SMACKS the phone from Pat and the DRUMMER follows through with a BRUTE-FORCE SHOVE. Gabe dives for the cell: ON THE PHONE: ‘911: 00:14...00:15...’ Gabe ends the call and pops up.
Big Justin brings up the rear, the Band caught mid-hallwa
They di- Gabe points to his ear.  34 35 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 26 BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D) THEY DIDN’T LOCK THE DOOR-
NO. DON’T TALK. AND DON’T TOUCH THEM. (to Band) STAY PUT. Gabe speaks into the Drummer’s ear. The Drummer nods.

(to Band) I'LL BE RIGHT BACK. DON’T WORRY. The Drummer backs off and leans against the wall. Big Jus stands opposite, the Guitarist visible over his shoulder the green room doorway, Amber within, her pleading eyes.
(to Pat)
(turning back) GIMME A MINUTE AND SAVE THE TALK. The Band processing adrenaline.
(to Sam) SOMETHING TERRIBLE. Pat nods compliance. Gabe disappears with the phone around a corner.

ON A WIDE: The back door opens and shuts, briefly polluti the quiet air with THRASH METAL. Gabe walks several yards to an OFFICE TRAILER. He disappe for several seconds, re-emerging with an awkward stride..
ON THE BAND: simmering, sharing looks, METAL still blarin Breathing regulates... -.-until Gabe returns with a RUGER .454 SUPER-REDHAWK REVOLVER by his side.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 27
Fuck me.
(gesturing with gun) JUST GET BACK INSIDE. Sam's cell RINGS, glowing in Gabe’s other hand.
LET’S GO!
Everyone shuffles inside, amped-up and bewildered.
Turn the PA down! He closes the door, Sam’s phone still RINGING. The Drummer reaches inside a counter cabinet and slides t fader on a two-channel MIXING BOARD wired to a ‘90s STERE
They didn’t lock it. Tiger sees the body, the knife, gestures to Reece and Sam
You were right there!
Until I wasn‘ t-
(hand up) Quiet! The THRASH METAL zeroes out, the Guitarist whips to Gabe.
(cordial, into phone) Hello? Yes, but we got cut off, it’s a bit- yes, ma’am...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 28 Gabe backs out the door...
(into phone) We called to report a stabbing... THE DOOR SHUTS. Behind it, GABE’S MUFFLED WORDS. Everyone eavesdropping until Gabe pops back through the d
You call Darcy?
He’s on his way. (gesturing to the corpse) Knows about that... (gesturing to the band) Not this...
You can’t keep us here.
We're not keeping you. You’re just staying. (nodding to Big Justin) You're up. Gabe hands Big Justin the gun.
The fuck is that supposed to mean?
(exiting) Relax. Cops are on the way. SLAM. Big Justin locks the dead bolt, glares at the Guitarist.
See how easy th- ? The victim’s Friend POUNCES ON WERM, her vicious strikes unanswered until the Guitarist pulls her off and THROWS H AGAINST THE WALL.
Chill the fuck out, Amber. Big Justin takes position by the door, pointing the gun.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 29
Yes please...
Gabe steps in, CLARK (40s), a grizzled scarecrow, rises f behind the desk of this dated but tidy office. Cubby hole and shelves of WHITE-POWER/NAZI MERCHANDISE line the wall
Darcy here?
Not yet. I need six hundred cash.
(opening a CASH BOX) You just signed out three fifty-
Someone's dead.
Still gotta keep the books.
Clark locks the office door, Gabe power-walks ahead.
(catching up) What do you need?
A true believer.
..-how ‘bout two?
Maybe she’s not dead. The Guitarist BLURTS a laugh. AMBER shoots him daggers.

text: Okay, okay, okay, okay!

text: Immediately, RHYTHMIC HACKING SOUNDS. PAT SCREAMS, fighting for leverage, pressing the door aga his own arm. BIG JUSTIN BUCKS, CATCHING REECE OFF GUARD.

SNAPPING BIG JUSTIN'S ARM AT THE ELBOW.

text: They pull Pat inside, HIS HAND NEARLY HACKED-OFF ABOVE TH WRIST. Reece barrels into the door, slamming it shut, twisting around and locking the bolt.

Oh god. Oh no...oh god...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 63 Two POUNDS on the door.
(through door) THIS’LL BE OVER SOON, GENTLEMEN. Big Justin staggers to his feet, HIS SNAPPED ARM DANGLING HIS SIDE.
..-fucking crush you... AMBER charges Big Justin, he winds-up his good arm... THWAK. CLOTHES-LINES HER TO THE FLOOR. Tiger sprawls, pushing the couch back against the door. BIG JUSTIN (CONT’D)
He goes for the BOX-CUTTER, Reece JUMPS ON HIS BACK, SECU A NECK CHOKE.

Get it! Big Justin staggers, in shock with no air, thumbing at th slide of his box-cutter. THE BLADE EXTENDS, BIG JUSTIN BLINDLY SLASHES AT REECE. AMBER GOES FOR THE WEAPON, GRABBING BIG JUSTIN'S WRIST.

head_text.subj: REECE CONSTRICTS WITH ALL HIS MIGHT AND JUSTIN FLUSHES RE

text: Amber wrestles the box-cutter away. Tiger sits facing Pat, registering the severity of his wounds: BLOOD, EXPOSED FAT, THE HAND SAGGING BY TENDONS.
Okayokayokayokay... Sam turns to Pat. Reece wraps his legs around Big Justin, now twitching helplessly, biting the air.
Tell me when he’s out!  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 64
(turning back) Okay... Tiger unlaces his battered Chuck Taylors. Big Justin's eyes go glassy and roll back.
He’s out. Reece holds several seconds, loosens his grip. Big Justin sags to the ground. OUTSIDE THE DOOR, MUFFLED MUSIC RESUMES OVER THE PA. Tiger pulls a striped tube sock from his foot.
Here... Tiger wraps the tube sock above Pat’s elbow, tightens a k Pat GRUNTS/SOBS/SPITS.
Tie it so there’s enough- Big Justin JOLTS RIGID AND PLANKS OUT. Startled, Tiger whips to see... BRAYING EXHALATIONS PUSH FOAMING SPIT through Big Justin' clenched teeth and flapping jowls.
He’s not out.
Fuck this. Reece wraps Big Justin up in a rear-naked choke. Big Justin comes to, locks eyes with Pat, glazing over.
(whispering) +.-Me too...
(to Tiger) We got this! Put pressure on that.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 65 Tiger removes his jacket, wraps it around Pat’s mangled a Amber, box-cutter in hand, steps to Reece.
You got it?
Yeah.
(whispering) .-Shoulda...locked...door...
Are we doing this? Amber crouches, face to face with Big Justin.

(whispering back) Problem wasn’t locking the door. Problem was killing my friend. Reece settles in. And squeezes. They watch. His regulated breaths. The tears streaming down his cheeks. Until it's done.
How long does it take? To be sure? Shrugs, looks. Amber RUNS THE BOX-CUTTER UP BIG JUSTIN’S BELLY.
(releases grip) Jesus. Tiger winces, looks to the door, dazed.
We...need... Pat clutching his wound, blood seeping through the jacket.  59 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 66
You said you saw daylight?
What? Yeah.

A stenciled ‘Ain't Rights’ logo lands into frame. Daniel stacks BRANDED CASES in the conversion van. SLAMMING the rear doors, he finds Gabe waiting with a MIL CRATE: inside, the BLOOD-SPATTERED .454 RUGER.
Any and all firearms. Clark will handle it from here... (to Gabe) He give you an ETA?
I told him no calls.
Right. Good. (re: milk crate) Phones too... The Skins gather, Daniel sees the BLOODY MACHETE.
What happened in there? A .25 CAL AUTO and a .38 SNUBNOSE are placed in the crate followed by three CELL PHONES.
(to Gabe) Set up Neil for tomorrow. New drywall, pour a floor. Say we had a leak. Gabe nods. Darcy checks his watch.
What happened?
(to Gabe) Door with a frame too. I’ve got carpet on hand- (MORE )
60 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 67
(to Daniel) Bit of a maelstrom tonight. Gabe and Darcy exchange looks. Darcy motions the Skins cl
Visiting band... (gestures to the van) ..-hurt one of ours.
Who? Gabe steps in, calming...
Emily.
Maybe Big Justin too.
(fury in his eyes) What the fuck are we doing? Let’s-
We are not coming apart is what we are doing. We are saving questions until this pig-fuck is transferred off site-
Darcy. Off Gabe’s nod, Darcy steps back and looks off: THROUGH THE TREES, PICKUP TRUCK HEADLIGHTS. Faintly, the CRUNCH of gravel, RATTLING, BARKING. Daniel swallows, intense.
Last chance if anyone needs to take a leak...

head_text.subj: PULLING OUT FROM THE LOCKED GREEN ROOM DOOR...

text: Outside, MUFFLED MUSIC... Inside, a RUCKUS...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 68 THEY’RE TEARING THE PLACE APART. Tiger, standing over the Sharpie ‘X’, PUMMELING FLOORBOAR with a MIC STAND. Amber SMASHING WALLS, EXPOSING BRICK. Sam, STABBING CEILING TILES with the aluminum frame, his shirt pulled over his nose. Reece drapes Big Justin’s jacket over his corpse.
I lost the gun...
You held on longer than I would've. Pat gives a drowsy smile. Reece turns to the rest. REECE (CONT’D) I'M GOING. Sam, Tiger and Amber keep up the DEMO.
There’s no air shaft, no sewer sys-— SMASH.
There we go... COOL LIGHT SPILLS up through a caved-in floorboard. Amber turns, watches Tiger and Sam peel up carpet.
What time is it?
That's not daylight.

It’s something... Reece SMASHES a chair, yanks off a leg, crosses... Reece drives the chair leg into the floor, STOMPS several times, BREAKING THROUGH. Sam and Tiger swoop in, prying away loose boards.  61 62 63 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 69 Sam, Tiger and Reece gaze down a PORTAL OF SPLINTERED WOO AND FLOATING PARTICLES.
Tiger is lowered into frame, past a DANGLING FLUORESCENT FIXTURE, surveying the interior.

Oh. Reece drops down behind him. Then Sam. Before them is a near century-old alcove. MODERN PLUMBING FIXTURES tapped into the old WATER MAIN lead to a moderni insulated room. ABOVE: SPRINKLERS and VENTILATION. BELOW: TARPED LAB EQUIPMENT, INDUSTIRAL TUBS and MIXERS.
Look for a door. Sam, Tiger and Reece spread out, rushing down the narrow isles between the equipment.
Amber, looking down the jagged hole in the floor. To Pat, huddled against the wall with labored breaths.
Just let me know. Amber sits, readying to drop.
Sorry about your friend. She nods, shoves off.
Sam pulls a plastic curtain: behind it, TANKS, CLIMATE CONTROL UNITS and SUPPLY SHELVING mounted on CONCRETE.
63 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 70
Nope. Reece rips away insulation, revealing RIBBED METAL WALLS.

Containers. Tiger parts heavy plastic sheeting and crosses into an 8x chamber housing INDUSTRIAL COFFEE GRINDERS, SCALES, AND B OF POWDER. At the far end, a LADDER LEADS TO A CEILING HA He sprints up it and grabs the welded handle. Doesn’t bud
Shit! Tiger drops down, Reece climbs up, gives it a try, POUNDS
Set twenty feet from the back of the venue, a charred, disused BARBECUE PIT. FAINT METALLIC THUMPS from underneath...
Reece drops down from the latch.
There a lock?
Other side maybe. We’re burning time. Sam tilts his gaze to the duct work above.
There’s ven- Reece is gone. Sam and Tiger jog after him... They push through the sheeting, crossing back.
There’s ventilation!

Four inch ducts. Good luck.  64 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 71 Amber stands by the entrance, taking in the operation. Tiger pulls back the plastic curtain, eyeing a roll of REFLECTIVE DUCT TAPE on the shelf.
Shouldn’t we look around? Reece kneels, offering Amber a boost.
We just did.
Amber pops back up through the floor. ON PAT, eager.
(getting to her feet) Heroin. This isn’t about her...us. Reece surfaces, reaches back for Sam and Tiger.
_ (popping up) Big ass bunker.
Big ass dead end. Pat sinks, Tiger knee-slides to his side.
Gimme your hand... Tiger pulls the jacket from around PAT’S HAND: EXPOSED TENDONS, LOSING BLOOD FAST. Pat grits his teeth.
Look away, dude...
Can’t we use this to our advantage?
(fights for composure) I’m done. Close the door behind me if you wanna strategize.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 72 Tiger yanks a length of DUCT TAPE from the roll, wraps th wound...
We're not ready.
What do you think they're doing?
That’s just it, we don’t know. Tiger winds the tape roll ‘round and ‘round, eyes welling
We know they mean us harm.
It’s just- if they have guns why aren't they mowing us down? Amber pockets the box-cutter, kneels by Emily’s corpse.
...can’t just go missing. They need us found...
Grab some shit, get ready to run.
We'll die... Reece picks up the wooden chair leg.
The longer we wait the surer that is. Ready? Tiger? Amber kisses Emily's forehead, covers her up.
(tears streaming) Almost... Tiger winds the tape...
We gotta treat this like paintball. Eyes on Pat. Even Amber wants to hear this.
Can’t take it so seriously...  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 73
Say what?

Rick Silva. He organized the paint ball for Skate-o’s bachelor party? Let me tag along. We were short a few players to book the whole field, so they paired us with these ex-Marines. First two games, they tore us to shreds. Zero casualties on their side- I just cowered behind trees until I was shot-
Tiger- you done? Tiger tears and smooths the duct tape, PAT’S HAND AND FOR NOW MUMMIFIED IN A METALLIC SHEEN.
Okay.
(to Pat) Gotta go. Sorry.
Okay. Amber fishes the box-cutter from her pocket.
Was that a pep talk? Tiger blows a snot-laugh, wipes his tears. Sam grabs the 4’ fluorescent bulb.
We won’t all live, but- I dunno- maybe we won't all die... Tiger lifts the aluminum ceiling frame, offers it to Pat, cradling his wounded arm.
(waving it off) I’m just gonna run.
Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)
Fuck it. Simon and Garfunkel. Heads turn, furrowed brows.
‘Desert island’ band.
Ha. Prince. They look to Pat...
Still the Misfits.
(with a nod) True school.

We going? Nods. PUSHING IN ON THE DOOR... The MUFFLED MUSIC. Reece puts a hand on the deadbolt, looks back. Battle positions. Sam taps the fluorescent bulb to the ground. POP. Raises ‘business end’ of jagged glass.
Here we go...
(under her breath) Madonna and Slayer... SHE THUMBS OUT THE BOX CUTTER BLADE...

head_text.subj: REECE SLAPS THE DEAD-BOLT UNLOCKED. TIGER YANKS OPEN THE

text: Watchit. 74  65 66 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 75 SAM JAVELIN-THROWS THE JAGGED FLUORESCENT BULB...
THE 4’ BULB SPEARS THROUGH THE AIR, IMPACTS THE FAR WALL EXPLODES INTO SHARDS AS THEY CHARGE THOUGH THE THRESHOLD. ..-INTO AN EMPTY HALLWAY.
(hushed) What the fuck?
(re: their gear) They loaded us out.
(to Amber) How many exits?
(pointing) The main, the back, maybe the kitchen? I alwa-
What about windows?
See for yourself. Reece has crept halfway down the hall. They follow...
As they reach the stage stairs, THE PA MUSIC FADES DOWN. Suddenly, eerily quiet. They crouch and find shadows, scanning the interior. Just darkness. SCUFFLING FOOTSTEPS. A SUBTLE CREAK.
Should we hide?  67 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 76
Whatever you want. Reece descends the stairs, jogs crouched towards the main entrance. Tiger, Sam, Amber and Pat follow.
We should split up.

Totally. No one breaks from the cluster. As they round the bar, waiting in the doorway: CLARK in silhouette, a BREAK STICK in one hand- in the ot a ROPE LEAD tethered to BROWNIE, an eighty-pound PIT BULL Lean, grizzled, panting eagerly.

He CLINKS a collar chain free and the PIT BULL (BROWNIE) bullets towards the crew. They scramble. Reece pivots, hops over the bar. Leaving Tiger exposed, frozen... THE PIT BULL (BROWNIE) RUNS TIGER DOWN AND GOES TO WORK. Amber breaks for the stage, rolls onto it. Sam sprints back up the stage stairs. Pat hobbles after.

FOLLOWING REECE down a corridor of industrial kitchen equipment, towards an exit door. He glides to a stop, tries the latch- locked. He sidestep an adjacent TOP-HINGED WINDOW, quietly pushes it open and slips outside...

head_text.subj: THROUGH THE GREASE-CAKED GLASS AS IT SWINGS SHUT
IN SILHOUETTE, ALAN CHARGES INTO FRAME, WHACKING REECE
REPEATEDLY TO THE GROUND WITH A CLEAVER.

text: 68 69 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 77
Gabe pulls Alan back.
Save it. Reece slumps to the ground with glazed eyes, BLEEDING OUT Gabe searches his pockets.

Aus! Aus! BROWNIE releases, lapping blood, tongue swinging. CLARK (CONT’D) Las es... VORAN! HOLD ON TIGER, his drifting eyes catch something... STRAPPED UNDER THE BAR COUNTER: A SAWED-OFF PUMP SHOTGUN. ON TIGER: just an observer now, calmly nearing lifelessne
Amber launches from behind a speaker stack, sprints acros

text: HE BRIDGES THE DISTANCE IN SECONDS, CLAMPING ON AMBER’S L
She crumples to the stage floor, BROWNIE SINKS HIS BITE A THRASHES .  70 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 78
(keeping his distance)

Amber topples a MIC STAND and starts BLUDGEONING BROWNIE its WEIGHTED BASE. Little effect. As she thrusts and winds up, the attached MICROPHONE cont the FLOOR MONITOR SPEAKER, causing FEEDBACK SURGES. BROWNIE twitches at the sound, anxiously finds new footin BETWEEN AMBER’S JABS, A HAND REACHES DOWN BEHIND HER, SNATCHING THE MICROPHONE FROM THE STAND. IT’S PAT, scared shitless. He presses the microphone to t monitor. The FEEDBACK SWELLS TO AN EAR-SPLITTING FREQUENCY.

head_text.subj: BROWNIE RELEASES HIS GRIP AND CIRCLES, MAKING ERRATIC LUN
AMBER CLUNKS HIM ON THE HEAD AND HE SCAMPERS OFF.

text: Amber, spent, looks back to Pat, the SCREECHING FEEDBACK music to their ears. Taped below the monitor is COWCATCHER’S SET LIST. Pat crinkles a brow, peels it up.

Sam unhooks a wall-mounted FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Fumbling, h snaps the plastic seal around the trigger pin. He creeps along, settling at the back entrance. He pulls the safety pin. Crouching, he kicks open the doo SCUFFLING.

head_text.subj: PFFFSHHHH. SAM TRIGGERS THE EXTINGUISHER, UNLEASHING A JE

text: Fuck! COUGHING AND GASPING AS KYLE’S MACHETE BLADE CUTS THROUGH BILLOWING CLOUD AND CLANKS AGAINST THE DOOR.  71 72 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 79
Shit! Sam kicks back, dragging the extinguisher, crawling to a The door SLAMS behind him. A MUFFLED EXCHANGE OUTSIDE.
Pat and Amber converge with Sam at the Green Room. Sam grips the extinguisher, Amber the mic stand.
They’re everywhere- you see Reece? Amber and Pat solemnly shake their heads. THE FEEDBACK PERSISTS.
Sam, Amber and Pat drop their gear and shove the couch against the battered door.
Here we are... Pat picks the napkin off Emily’s corpse, hands Sam the COWCATCHER SET LIST.
Third one down.
(reading set list) Fleish..wo- Fleischwolf? Pat holds up the napkin: ‘Fleischwolf’. They look to Amber.
It’s a song.
Agreed.
.»..means ‘meat-grinder’.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)
80 73 Darcy pacing, Clark leading the BLOOD-BATHED PIT (BROWNIE the tailgate of his truck and into a CRATE.
(patting dog) So ist brav...
You retiring him?
He’s worked up.
Send another. Send two. Finish it.
Kill that feedback first. (locking crate) And if I send in two fighting dogs, whaddya think they’1l do? Darcy digests that thought, Daniel steps up.
Send me in there. I'll finish up. Darcy considers.
Just give me the rules.
Alright. Blades only. Sloppy is fine, but try not to hit the bone.
(already moving) Okay.
Take Jonathan. Jonathan joins Daniel, they clasp hands.
Brute squad.
(to Clark) Keep them caged ‘till we tag out?  74 75 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14)
Gabe rounds the corner, pulling REECE’S BODY 81 by the feet. He spots Daniel and Jonathan heading into the venue, mach in hand.
(re: the body) He breathing?
(turning) Little, yeah.
Let him bleed- later is better with time of death. Keys? Gabe shakes‘no’.

74 TRACKING BEHIND DANIEL AND JONATHAN, MACHETES IN HAND... Moving fluidly past the bar, Daniel goes straight for the green room, Jonathan hops onto the stage, yanks the microphone from the monitor speaker and kills the switch.
Sam, Amber and Pat look to the door.
They’re coming. MUFFLED FOOTSTEPS up the hallway...

I can't do this... PFFUMP. PFFUMP. CRACK. The door is succumbing to BOOT STRIKES. Sam readies his fire extinguisher, Pat steps Amber grips the mic stand. 75 back.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 82 PFFUMP. CRUNCH. SPLINTERING AROUND THE DEADBOLT. CRACK! DANIEL BUSTS THE DOOR OPEN, sliding the couch inwa SAM FIRES HIS EXTINGUISHER, FORCING DANIEL BACK. The CLOUD envelops the room. ZERO VISIBILITY. They hear Daniel SCUFFLING his way back inside.
SAM FIRES ANOTHER JET OF RETARDANT, but Daniel is on him snatches the extinguisher away. DANIEL KICKS SAM TO THE FLOOR.
Daniel wafts the air, sweeps the ground, pulling the jack off BIG JUSTIN’S GUTTED CORPSE.
Daniel! Jonathan enters, thrown off, the CLOUD settling.
Fuck are you doing?
He’s the one... Pat holds up the napkin, looks to Amber.
..+.-gave her this. Daniel pulls the blanket off EMILY’S CORPSE.
Hey! Daniel white-knuckles the machete, acknowledging Amber.
Which one did it?
Werm did it.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 83
Bullshit. Which one? Sam COUGHS, covered in fire retardant, disappears down th hole in the floor. Jonathan observes with mounting confus
What’d they tell you, Daniel? Daniel, dead-eyed.
You want to know? (nodding to Jonathan) You want him to know?
Know what? Amber putting it together.
Werm found out she was leaving. She didn’t say it was with you- during the show. (turning to Pat) Meatgrinder. The song was their cue. All eyes on Daniel.
(turning to Jonathan) You should go.
Darcy paces, Clark leads another PIT BULL (JD) from its c
They're taking too long. Darcy walks to Gabe, TARPING REECE’S BODY NEXT TO TIGER’S
You didn’t want Daniel on door duty. Why?
Nothing concrete. He... and Emily. Darcy does an about-face...  77 78 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 84
ON THE VISOR OF DANIEL’S ‘65 RAGTOP. Darcy flips it down, catches the keys. TRACKING WITH HIM AS HE OPENS THE TRUNK.
Packed to the hilt with BOXES, BEDDING, RECORDS, ARTIFACT ONE SIDE: HIS. ONE SIDE: HERS. Darcy swipes a FRAMED PICTURE from one of the boxes. THE PICTURE: Emily and friends, way back when.

Little love birds... Darcy reaches to shut the trunk, notices something tucked deep inside, pulls it out... AN ALUMINUM BASEBALL BAT, WRAPPED IN A CLEAR GARBAGE BAG. It's weathered, spattered with DRIED, FLAKING BLOOD.
Darcy approaches Gabe with the bat, still wrapped in the Gabe frozen with dread.
Recognize this?
No sir.

Course not. You were handing out leaflets when these boys made their bones. (offering the bat) It’s from last Easter. And it was supposed to disappear after the boot party... Jonathan pushes out the exit, walking briskly with his machete, dusted with FIRE RETARDANT.  79 80 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 85
He just started talking? Amber's alive, saying Werm did it-
(to Jonathan) Never mind that. Darcy steps to Gabe...
You... ...and kisses his forehead.
...Werm- just saved us all.
Pat is lowered by his good arm from the hole above, his f hit the floor.
Sam? Just the empty lab.
It’s okay. Amber drops down behind him. Then Daniel.
I mean, it’s not okay, but he’s with us. We gotta split. Pat continues towards the adjacent shipping container. Daniel takes in the operation.
You didn’t know either.
Not where.
Pat steps in, finds Sam sizing up an INDUSTRIAL FAN.  81 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 86
This has a wider duct. I think. (turning) Reece was full of shit. Sam, swollen puffy eyes.
We won’t fit through there...
Signed with Battletorn. That’s why he was so pressed. All his calls- lining up a big winter tour...
Daniel can help.
Why? Who’s he?
(stepping in) A traitor. If they didn’t already know, they know now. I can get us out.
Wow, a conspiracy?
No, just a clusterfuck.
Darcy addresses the crew, Clark paces with his PIT (JD).
Light has been shed. Daniel and Emily, it appears, had ill intentions... Darcy holds up the bat. Some MURMURS from the Skins.

So it is with renewed vigor we will see this through. Everything is at stake, and for us all. Gabe presents the milk crate, the Skins retrieve the .25 AUTO, the .38 SNUBNOSE. Darcy picks up the .454 RUGER.  82 83 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 87

We're still blades and fangs for the visitors, but we’re getting lean on time. If you have to shoot- shoot once. More than once- keep a tight grouping cuz you'll be digging the slugs out yourself. As for Daniel and Am- wait... Gabe uncaps a pen, ready to amend his POST-IT. Darcy turn the Bartender, taps him on the chest.
..-what did we forget?
Daniel leads Amber, Sam and Pat along the hall...
Daniel, THE MACHETE. Amber, THE MIC STAND. Sam, THE EXTINGUISHER. Pat, THE BOX CUTTER.
They descend the stairs...
There’s a river on two sides, the quarry on another. We can parallel the main road back, go for help.
How do we get past the door? Daniel veers off, circles behind the bar.
I know something you don’t... Daniel sets his machete atop the bar, runs his hand underneath, tosses up a FEW SHOTGUN SHELLS...
Good. What? Sam watches a SHELL roll along the bar and CLINK AGAINST DARCY'S UNTOUCHED SHOT GLASS. He downs it.  Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 88
...I know where we kee- BOOM. DANIEL’S SKULL COMES APART IN A BLAST OF BUCKSHOT, BODY BUCKLES AND FALLS. PAT JUMPS, DROPS THE BOX-CUTTER. SAM, SPLATTERED IN GORE, DROPS THE SHOT GLASS.
Too slow... The Bartender floats from the shadows, PUMPS A SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN and sweeps it towards Amber. She ducks, DEFLECTS WITH THE MIC STAND. BOOM. THE WALL EXPLODES.

head_text.subj: SAM FIRES HIS EXTINGUISHER, CHOKING THE BARTENDER WITH

text: PAT GRABS DANIEL’S MACHETE FROM THE BAR, SWINGS IT REFLEXIVELY INTO THE BARTENDER’S NECK AND BACK. The Bartender shrugs, the gun sagging in his grip. HIS PRISTINE, POWDERED NECK GAPES OPEN AND BELCHES BLOOD.
Oh dear... Amber gently takes the shotgun, aims it back... But he’s already sliding into his own pool of blood, mout GURGLED WORDS.

(to Pat) Thank- CRASH. The kitchen door slams open. Sam and Amber trade g looks as they back away. Pat pockets some SHOT SHELLS off the bar. A CLANK. The PATTER of paws scraping against concrete. Amber bears down on the main entrance. CLARK rounds the corner with the PIT (JD), flinches at th sight of Amber’s raised shotgun, YANKING THE DOG back out sight.  84 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 89
(turning back) Should we go? Now? CLANK. MUFFLED YELLING from the back hall.
We have a gun. I guess?
Yes?
(to Pat) Gimme two! Pat hands over two SHOT SHELLS, Amber loads as she walks. Sam and Pat follow in line, gaining momentum until they S IN UNISON TOWARDS THE EXIT...

head_text.subj: AMBER KICKS THE DOOR OPEN, THEY SPILL OUT...
MET BY A HAIL OF BULLETS THAT RIDDLE THE AWNING...
DARCY, THE SKINS, WERE JUST WAITING...

text: DARCY (CONT’D) NOT HIM- DON’T FIRE! FROM THE FLANK, CLARK RELEASES HIS PIT (JD) WITH A SMACK.
85 86 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 90
SAM! Come on! FUMBLING, SAM PUMPS THE ACTION AND AIMS FOR THE DOG. BOOM. JD LOOSES A HUNK OF FLESH BUT DOESN’T MISS A STEP.

head_text.subj: HE LEAPS ONTO SAM AND TOPPLES HIM, EATING HIS CHEST BY TH
PAT PULLS AMBER BACK THROUGH THE ENTRANCE...

text: Pat and Amber hobble back up the stage stairs.
We're not getting out...
They push through the battered door and shut it.
Guess it was always going to end here.
At least we bought some time. Pat sets her on the couch, crosses to the bathroom.
So I’m curious. You're smart... He turns on the sink faucet and gulps water.
I don’t see how you fall for this shit...
I didn’t fall for anything. I was raped once and mugged twice. Let’s just say none of them were white. Pat nods, gulping water.
Any of them women?  87 Pre-Production Draft v.2 (9/07/14) 91
It’s a problem where I grew up.
What about tonight? [slurp] Think we gotta white people problem? Amber, losing her mirth.
Fuck you. Pat turns the faucet off.
(kindly) Fuck yourself. He joins her on the couch, they sink into the oversized cushions.
I’m the lucky one- they might shoot me. Pat's eyes drift to the makeup counter, the unplugged hai clippers under the WALL SOCKET.
...cell phones ruin everything.

-full cammo, thousand dollar automatic paint-guns. They knew real war and they played real war. Tactics, hand signals, flanking- just wiped us all out. So Rick gets fed up and says ‘fuck it’. The last match, the whistle blows and he just tears out there- full jackass, in cut-offs and sneakers- and takes out their entire team. Never stops. Just running and shooting and laughing until they’re all dead.
